publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-793# Fiona Hyslop: Public Consultation on Private Prisons-That the Parliament notes the concerns of many of its members and amongst the wider public about the proposals for private prisons in Scotland; notes that applications for two new prisons have now been lodged in Addiewell and Low Moss but that as yet the public have not been informed if either or both are intended to operate as private prisons, and expresses the view that the public should be entitled to know what kind of operation is being planned for their local communities as part of any consultation and decision-making process. Supported by: Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Stewart Stevenson*, Michael Matheson*, Mark Ballard*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Colin Fox*, Tommy Sheridan*, Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-793# Fiona Hyslop: Public Consultation on Private Prisons-That the Parliament notes the concerns of many of its members and amongst the wider public about the proposals for private prisons in Scotland; notes that applications for two new prisons have now been lodged in Addiewell and Low Moss but that as yet the public have not been informed if either or both are intended to operate as private prisons, and expresses the view that the public should be entitled to know what kind of operation is being planned for their local communities as part of any consultation and decision-making process. Supported by: Mr Stewart Maxwell, Stewart Stevenson, Michael Matheson, Mark Ballard, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Colin Fox, Tommy Sheridan, Dr Jean Turner, Patrick Harvie*, Linda Fabiani*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Robin Harper*, Bruce Crawford*, Jim Mather*, Shiona Baird*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Christine Grahame*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-793# Public Consultation on Private Prisons (lodged on 15 January 2004) Tricia Marwick*, Ms Sandra White*, Alex Neil*
S2M-793# Public Consultation on Private Prisons (lodged on 15 January 2004) Brian Adam*
S2M-793# Public Consultation on Private Prisons (lodged on 15 January 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-793# Public Consultation on Private Prisons (lodged on 15 January 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-793# Fiona Hyslop: Public Consultation on Private Prisons-That the Parliament notes the concerns of many of its members and amongst the wider public about the proposals for private prisons in Scotland; notes that applications for two new prisons have now been lodged in Addiewell and Low Moss but that as yet the public have not been informed if either or both are intended to operate as private prisons, and expresses the view that the public should be entitled to know what kind of operation is being planned for their local communities as part of any consultation and decision-making process. Supported by: Mr Stewart Maxwell, Stewart Stevenson, Michael Matheson, Mark Ballard, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Colin Fox, Tommy Sheridan, Dr Jean Turner, Patrick Harvie, Linda Fabiani, Nicola Sturgeon, Robin Harper, Bruce Crawford, Jim Mather, Shiona Baird, Marilyn Livingstone, Christine Grahame, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Tricia Marwick, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Brian Adam, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Rosemary Byrne
S2M-793# Public Consultation on Private Prisons (lodged on 15 January 2004) Rob Gibson*
